32namespace webrtc {
33namespace {
34
35rtc::ThreadPriority TaskQueuePriorityToThreadPriority(
36 TaskQueueFactory::Priority priority) {
37 switch (priority) {
38 case TaskQueueFactory::Priority::HIGH:
39 return rtc::ThreadPriority::kRealtime;
40 case TaskQueueFactory::Priority::LOW:
41 return rtc::ThreadPriority::kLow;
42 case TaskQueueFactory::Priority::NORMAL:
43 return rtc::ThreadPriority::kNormal;
44 }
45}
46
47class TaskQueueStdlib final : public TaskQueueBase {
48 public:
49 TaskQueueStdlib(absl::string_view queue_name, rtc::ThreadPriority priority);
50 ~TaskQueueStdlib() override = default;
51
52 void Delete() override;
53 void PostTask(std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask> task) override;
54 void PostDelayedTask(std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask> task,
55 uint32_t milliseconds) override;
56
57 private:
58 using OrderId = uint64_t;
59
60 struct DelayedEntryTimeout {
61 int64_t next_fire_at_ms_{};
62 OrderId order_{};
63
64 bool operator<(const DelayedEntryTimeout& o) const {
65 return std::tie(next_fire_at_ms_, order_) <
66 std::tie(o.next_fire_at_ms_, o.order_);
67 }
68 };
69
70 struct NextTask {
71 bool final_task_{false};
72 std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask> run_task_;
73 int64_t sleep_time_ms_{};
74 };
75
76 NextTask GetNextTask();
77
78 void ProcessTasks();
79
80 void NotifyWake();
81
82 // Indicates if the thread has started.
83 rtc::Event started_;
84
85 // Indicates if the thread has stopped.
86 rtc::Event stopped_;
87
88 // Signaled whenever a new task is pending.
89 rtc::Event flag_notify_;
90
91#if !defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD)
92 // Contains the active worker thread assigned to processing
93 // tasks (including delayed tasks).
94 rtc::PlatformThread thread_;
95#endif
96
97 Mutex pending_lock_;
98
99 // Indicates if the worker thread needs to shutdown now.
100 bool thread_should_quit_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(pending_lock_){false};
101
102 // Holds the next order to use for the next task to be
103 // put into one of the pending queues.
104 OrderId thread_posting_order_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(pending_lock_){};
105
106 // The list of all pending tasks that need to be processed in the
107 // FIFO queue ordering on the worker thread.
108 std::queue<std::pair<OrderId, std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask>>> pending_queue_
109 RTC_GUARDED_BY(pending_lock_);
110
111 // The list of all pending tasks that need to be processed at a future
112 // time based upon a delay. On the off change the delayed task should
113 // happen at exactly the same time interval as another task then the
114 // task is processed based on FIFO ordering. std::priority_queue was
115 // considered but rejected due to its inability to extract the
116 // std::unique_ptr out of the queue without the presence of a hack.
117 std::map<DelayedEntryTimeout, std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask>> delayed_queue_
118 RTC_GUARDED_BY(pending_lock_);
119
120#if defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD)
121 // Contains the active worker thread assigned to processing
122 // tasks (including delayed tasks).
123 rtc::PlatformThread thread_;
124#endif
125};
126
127TaskQueueStdlib::TaskQueueStdlib(absl::string_view queue_name,
128 rtc::ThreadPriority priority)
129 : started_(/*manual_reset=*/false, /*initially_signaled=*/false),
130 stopped_(/*manual_reset=*/false, /*initially_signaled=*/false),
131 flag_notify_(/*manual_reset=*/false, /*initially_signaled=*/false),
132 thread_(rtc::PlatformThread::SpawnJoinable(
133 [this] {
134 CurrentTaskQueueSetter set_current(this);
135 ProcessTasks();
136 },
137 queue_name,
138 rtc::ThreadAttributes().SetPriority(priority))) {
139 started_.Wait(rtc::Event::kForever);
140}
141
142void TaskQueueStdlib::Delete() {
143 RTC_DCHECK(!IsCurrent());
144
145 {
146 MutexLock lock(&pending_lock_);
147 thread_should_quit_ = true;
148 }
149
150 NotifyWake();
151
152 stopped_.Wait(rtc::Event::kForever);
153 thread_.Finalize();
154 delete this;
155}
156
157void TaskQueueStdlib::PostTask(std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask> task) {
158 {
159 MutexLock lock(&pending_lock_);
160 OrderId order = thread_posting_order_++;
161
162 pending_queue_.push(std::pair<OrderId, std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask>>(
163 order, std::move(task)));
164 }
165
166 NotifyWake();
167}
168
169void TaskQueueStdlib::PostDelayedTask(std::unique_ptr<QueuedTask> task,
170 uint32_t milliseconds) {
171 auto fire_at = rtc::TimeMillis() + milliseconds;
172
173 DelayedEntryTimeout delay;
174 delay.next_fire_at_ms_ = fire_at;
175
176 {
177 MutexLock lock(&pending_lock_);
178 delay.order_ = ++thread_posting_order_;
179 delayed_queue_[delay] = std::move(task);
180 }
181
182 NotifyWake();
183}
184
185TaskQueueStdlib::NextTask TaskQueueStdlib::GetNextTask() {
186 NextTask result{};
187
188 auto tick = rtc::TimeMillis();
189
190 MutexLock lock(&pending_lock_);
191
192 if (thread_should_quit_) {
193 result.final_task_ = true;
194 return result;
195 }
196
197 if (delayed_queue_.size() > 0) {
198 auto delayed_entry = delayed_queue_.begin();
199 const auto& delay_info = delayed_entry->first;
200 auto& delay_run = delayed_entry->second;
201 if (tick >= delay_info.next_fire_at_ms_) {
202 if (pending_queue_.size() > 0) {
203 auto& entry = pending_queue_.front();
204 auto& entry_order = entry.first;
205 auto& entry_run = entry.second;
206 if (entry_order < delay_info.order_) {
207 result.run_task_ = std::move(entry_run);
208 pending_queue_.pop();
209 return result;
210 }
211 }
212
213 result.run_task_ = std::move(delay_run);
214 delayed_queue_.erase(delayed_entry);
215 return result;
216 }
217
218 result.sleep_time_ms_ = delay_info.next_fire_at_ms_ - tick;
219 }
220
221 if (pending_queue_.size() > 0) {
222 auto& entry = pending_queue_.front();
223 result.run_task_ = std::move(entry.second);
224 pending_queue_.pop();
225 }
226
227 return result;
228}
229
230void TaskQueueStdlib::ProcessTasks() {
231 started_.Set();
232
233 while (true) {
234 auto task = GetNextTask();
235
236 if (task.final_task_)
237 break;
238
239 if (task.run_task_) {
240 // process entry immediately then try again
241 QueuedTask* release_ptr = task.run_task_.release();
242 if (release_ptr->Run())
243 delete release_ptr;
244
245 // attempt to sleep again
246 continue;
247 }
248
249 if (0 == task.sleep_time_ms_)
250 flag_notify_.Wait(rtc::Event::kForever);
251 else
252 flag_notify_.Wait(task.sleep_time_ms_);
253 }
254
255 stopped_.Set();
256}
257
258void TaskQueueStdlib::NotifyWake() {
259 // The queue holds pending tasks to complete. Either tasks are to be
260 // executed immediately or tasks are to be run at some future delayed time.
261 // For immediate tasks the task queue's thread is busy running the task and
262 // the thread will not be waiting on the flag_notify_ event. If no immediate
263 // tasks are available but a delayed task is pending then the thread will be
264 // waiting on flag_notify_ with a delayed time-out of the nearest timed task
265 // to run. If no immediate or pending tasks are available, the thread will
266 // wait on flag_notify_ until signaled that a task has been added (or the
267 // thread to be told to shutdown).
268
269 // In all cases, when a new immediate task, delayed task, or request to
270 // shutdown the thread is added the flag_notify_ is signaled after. If the
271 // thread was waiting then the thread will wake up immediately and re-assess
272 // what task needs to be run next (i.e. run a task now, wait for the nearest
273 // timed delayed task, or shutdown the thread). If the thread was not waiting
274 // then the thread will remained signaled to wake up the next time any
275 // attempt to wait on the flag_notify_ event occurs.
276
277 // Any immediate or delayed pending task (or request to shutdown the thread)
278 // must always be added to the queue prior to signaling flag_notify_ to wake
279 // up the possibly sleeping thread. This prevents a race condition where the
280 // thread is notified to wake up but the task queue's thread finds nothing to
281 // do so it waits once again to be signaled where such a signal may never
282 // happen.
283 flag_notify_.Set();
284}
285
286class TaskQueueStdlibFactory final : public TaskQueueFactory {
287 public:
288 std::unique_ptr<TaskQueueBase, TaskQueueDeleter> CreateTaskQueue(
289 absl::string_view name,
290 Priority priority) const override {
291 return std::unique_ptr<TaskQueueBase, TaskQueueDeleter>(
292 new TaskQueueStdlib(name, TaskQueuePriorityToThreadPriority(priority)));
293 }
294};
295
296} // namespace
297
298std::unique_ptr<TaskQueueFactory> CreateTaskQueueStdlibFactory() {
299 return std::make_unique<TaskQueueStdlibFactory>();
300}
301
302} // namespace webrtc
